"What I can't understand is how so many, so called, intellectuals still think communism/socialism/progressivism will work . . ."
Actually they just HOPE it will work. It is FEAR that drives them. From Revel's "Last Exit to Utopia":
"[It relates] to warding two fears that are present in each of us: the fear of competition and the fear of responsibility. These fears are not just vague apprehensions; they are dominating Anxieties. Membership in a redistributive economy allays these fears and reduces stress. The statist machine promises the psychological Comfort of not having to bear the burden of responsibility for oneself."
Paste this up on your mirror
